main event: A military ground-radar system detected an unidentified flying object (UFO) near Miho Air Base, Japan on July 14, 1960.
interesting points: The object was observed to be 4-5 times the size of the full moon, white in color, and appeared to have a short tail.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of approximately 600 mph.
The object seemed to be 'burning' as it disappeared from view after 5-6 seconds of observation.
The report notes that the description and duration of the sighting are characteristic of a fireball or meteor, but the reported speed is considered excessive for a meteor.
The report concludes that there were no satellites reported to be reentering the atmosphere at the time, and the maneuver characteristics are not consistent with a meteor or other natural phenomenon.
sighted object: a large, white, fast-moving object with a short tail
location: 2 miles east of Miho Air Base, Japan
